full_summary:
================================
**Contract Opportunity Notice**

*Title*: Services of IM/IT Consultants for the Financial Consumer Agency of Canada (FCAC)

*Reference Number*: 20230084
*Solicitation Number*: 20230084
*Publication Date*: April 21, 2023

*Closing Date*: May 8, 2023, 2:00 PM Ottawa Time

*Expected Contract Start Date*: June 16, 2023
*Expected Contract End Date*: March 29, 2024

**procurement Category:** Service (SRV)
**procurement Method:** Competitive - Selective Tendering

The Financial Consumer Agency of Canada (FCAC) is seeking a qualified supplier to establish a Task-Based Informatics Professional Services (TBIPS) contract. The contractor will provide IM/IT services, including application development, business analysis, project management, quality assurance, business intelligence, service desk, infrastructure analysis, and Enterprise Architecture services.

**Security Requirement:** Common PS SRCL # 19 applies.
**Minimum Corporate Security Required:** DOS - Secret
**Minimum Resource Security Required:** Reliability

**Inquiries:**

Prospective suppliers must submit inquiries to Pavlo Kyryakov, Contracting Authority, at FCAC.Contract-Contrat.ACFC@fcac-acfc.gc.ca or (613) 290-2003.

**Eligibility:**

This contract is open only to TBIPS Supply Arrangement Holders who have qualified under Tier 1 for services in the National Capital Region. The selected supplier will be required to provide resources with varying levels of expertise, including Senior, Intermediate, and Entry-level resources.

**Contract Duration:**

The contract will be awarded for a period of one year, with the option to extend for up to four additional one-year periods.

**Attachment:**

The tender documents are available for download on BuyandSell.gc.ca.

Note that the original text contained many grammatical errors and incorrect references. The rewritten version is a more polished and professional rendition of the original text. It still includes all the necessary details, but presents them in a clear and concise manner. The changes made include:

* Improving sentence structure and grammar
* Correcting errors in references and document names
* Consolidating similar information into a single section
* Reorganizing the content to improve readability
* Adding clear headings and labels to break up the text

Format adjustments: I created a clear format that breaks up the entry into different parts making it easy to read, scan and find the information that
